respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

msDesc.head: Ordines Romani. Central Italy, early 12th century.

msContents.summary: Ordines Romani. The contents of this manuscript and the rubrics are identical with those of the 11th-century Italian manuscripts MSS. Vat. Lat. 1146-8, as described by Andrieu, I, 296-300. For the relationship between MSS. St. Gall 446 and Bamberg Lit. 131, and these manuscripts, see Andrieu, I, 481-4.

msItem.title: Ordo Romanus I
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber officiorum qualiter missa Romana agatur
msItem.note: (pr. M. Andrieu, Les ordines Romani, tome II (Spicileg. sacrum Lovanense, 23, 1948), 67-108), with 17th-century marginal notes in Latin and Greek.

msItem.author: Amalarius of Metz
msItem.title: Eclogae de ordine Romano et de quattuor orationibus in missa
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt egloge Amalarii de ordine Romano et de quattuor orationibus episcoporum sive populi
msItem.incipit: Capituli sequentes opusculi ... laudantes et benedicentes deum qui vivit et ...
msItem.note: (pr. Amalarii opera, ed. J. Hanssens, tom. III (Studi e testi, 140, 1950), 225-265).

msItem.title: Ordo Romanus VII
msItem.note: (part)
msItem.rubric: Qualiter quedam orationes et cruces intergiter agenda sunt
msItem.explicit: fiat remedium sempiternum per dominum nostrus IC
msItem.note: (pr. Andrieu, II, 296-305)

msItem.title: Commentary on the Mass

rubric.hi: Hec a cenobio Dionisii venit. Incipit expositio misse

msItem.note: (pr. PL, CXXXVIII, 1173-86; for other MSS. and editions, see Andrieu, op. cit., tome I (Spicilieg. sacrum Lovanesnse, 11, 1931), 337.)

msItem.author: Rabanus Maurus
msItem.title: De institutione clericorum
msItem.note: (extracts; ed. Knoepfler), all four follow Knoepfler's 'recensio F':
(ed. Knoepfler, ch. 24 p. 41).
(ibid., ch. 31 p. 59)
For other manuscripts see Andrieu, I, 337-8.

msItem.title: Capitula
msItem.rubric: In dei nomine pauca ex auditorum virorum voluminibus excepta. Incipiunt capitula de catholica aecclesia et eius ministris et de baptismatis officio. Ista capitula a palatio Aquisgrani venerunt
msItem.note: (pr. M. Gerbert, II, 291-3)

msItem.author: Amalarius of Metz
msItem.title: Canonis missae interpretatio
msItem.note: (pr. Hanssans I, 284-338.)

msItem.author: Theodulf of Orleans
msItem.title: Capitula
msItem.rubric: Haec et que secunter capitula Theotulfus Aurelianensis edidit

msItem.explicit: fideliterque credentibus vitam et gloriam sempiternam
msItem.note: (='Fragmenta sermonum', pr. PL, CV, 275-82).

msItem.explicit: misericors dominus intromittat. Qui vivat etc.
msItem.note: (='Fragmenta sermonum', pr. PL, CV, 280-2)
(='Fragmenta sermonum', pr. PL, CV, 282)

The third of these is headed 'Cap. III', and there is no division between the third and fourth item, 'cap. IV' begins at 'Veraciter nesse' (col. 192B), so that ch. II of the pr. text is here numbered V, and the rest accordingly. Other manuscripts with the text in this order are St. Gall 446, p. 170, and Vat. Lat. 1147, fol. 27v (Andrieu, I, 342).

msItem.rubric: Inquisitio beati Damasi pape urbis Rome ad Ieronimum presbiterum
msItem.note: (both apocrypha, ed. from St. Gall 446, p. 204, by Knoepfler, pp. 70, 71 n. 3).
(found also in MSS. Bamberg Lit. 131, fol. 76v, and Vat. Lat. 1147, fol. 36v (cf. Andrieu, I, 85 and 298))

msItem.author: Heito Augiensis
msItem.title: Capitula
msItem.rubric: Hec capitula que secunter Ahlto Basiliensis aecclesie antistes et abbas cenobii quod Augia dicitur presbiteris sue diocesis ordinavit quibus monerentur qualiter seipsos ac plebem sibi commissam caste et iuste regere atque in religione divina confirmare debeant
msItem.note: (pr. PL, CV, 763-8). The same rubric is found in MSS. St. Gall. 446, Bamberg Lit. 131, and Vat. Lat. 1147, fol. 37; see Andrieu, I, 342.

msItem.author: Walahfrid Strabo
msItem.title: Libellus de exordiis et incrementis quarundam in observationibus ecclesiasticis rerum
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellum Walafredis Strabonis de exordiis et incrementis quarundam in observationibus ecclesiasticis rerum
msItem.note: (ed. Knoepfler, op. cit.), preceded by the poem 'Hoc opus egregium Walfredus pauper hebesque' (ed. E. Dummler, MGH Poet. Lat., II, 417 no. 79).

msItem.author: Rabanus Maurus
msItem.title: De clericorum institutione
msItem.note: (ed. Knoepfler, op. cit.; for other MSS. containing this extract see Andrieu, I, 337).

msItem.title: Exposition on the Pater noster, conducted by question and answer
msItem.incipit: Pater noster ... Quomodo vocatur hec ratio?
msItem.explicit: sed potius liberet ab omni malo. Qui vivit etc.
msItem.note: (also found in Vat. Lat. 1147, fol. 63v, Andrieu, I, 298).
Second texts of 'Sunt autem sacramenta ...' and 'Maluit autem ...'.

msItem.author: Amalarius of Metz
msItem.title: Liber officialis
msItem.note: (similar texts are in MSS. Vat. Lat. 1146-8, Bamberg Lit. 331; see Andrieu, I, 299).

msItem.title: Extracts on baptism from Isidore , Ambrose , and John the Deacon
msItem.rubric: Incipit de baptismo et omni eius ordine iuxta indaginem catholicorum
msItem.note: The extracts on fols. 65r-66r form ch. 3-6, 8, 9, 11-14 and 16-22 of Odilbert, Liber de baptismo (ed. Wiegand, (Liepzig, 1899); the collection of extracts in this MS. is also found in MSS. Vat. Lat. 1147, fol. 69, and Bamberg Lit. 331, fol. 125v; see Andrieu, I, 86 and 299.

msItem.title: Text on catechumens
msItem.explicit: non abebitis vitam in vobis finit
msItem.note: This and the following item are in MSS. Vat. lat. 1147, fol. 70v, and Bamberg 131, fols. 125v-138r; see Andrieu, loc. cit.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: Letter to Oduin
msItem.note: (shortened version)
(pr. M.G.H. epist, IV, 202).

msItem.title: Text on catechumens and baptism
msItem.rubric: De ordine ad fidem ut venientium quorum primus gradus est catecuminorum secundus competentium tertius baptizatorum. De catecumini Isidorus
msItem.incipit: Catecumini sunt qui qui primo de gentilitate
msItem.note: (Differing somewhat from the text pr. in Spicileg. Casinense, I, 337-341; found also in MS. Vat. Lat. 1147, fol. 73r; see Andrieu, loc. cit.).

msItem.author: Amalarius of Metz
msItem.title: Liber officialis
msItem.note: (ed. Hanssens, II, here in four books, with the prefaces 'Gloriosissime imperator ...', and 'Ubi sanctus Augustinus ...', and letters I, II, IV-VI, at the end of book III; cf. Hanssens, Ephemerides liturgicae, 48 (1934), pp. 76-9; belonging to Hanssens recensio II.)

layoutDesc.layout: 41-5 lines, written above the top ruled line; in 2 column

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine 12th-century (?) marginal leadpoint sketches of a man (3 versions: fols. 18r, 28r, 178r); and wading birds (fols. 32r, 36r). Fine 12th-century (?) marginal drypoint sketches of: a devil or three-horned figure (?) (fol. 10r); a male figure, blessing, riding sideways on an ass (the Entry into Jersualem (?)), a male figure (Christ (?)) standing, blessing, and a male head (fol. 68v); animal (ass/horse (?)) heads (fol. 120r, fore-edge and lower margins); a seated male figure (Christ or a king (?)), blessing (?) (fol. 183v); Virgin and Child, both nimbed (fol. 189v); a male head in profile, and two studies of a pair of legs, from the knee downwards (fol. 191v); a standing figure with outstretched arm (fol. 193v). Poor 12th-century (?) marginal leadpoint sketches of a soldier (fol. 44r); a human-plant hybrid including the upper part of a doctor (?) inspecting a specimen-jar, a large initial 'A', and other foliate and animal designs (fol. 136r). (P&A ii. 26, pl. III)

history.provenance: There are corrections throughout in a 12th-century hand.
Bookplate of ' THOMAS WILLIAM COKE ' (1754-1842); formerly Norfolk, Holkham Hall, MS. 32.

recordHist.source: Draft description by Peter Kidd, late 1990s
